issues.description: The problem statement refers to the main class as 'Lecture' throughout the narrative and tasks, but the embedded UML diagram incorrectly labels it as 'Course'. This discrepancy could confuse students, leading them to believe they need to implement a class named 'Course' instead of 'Lecture', disrupting the mapping from requirements to code implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Update the UML diagram in the problem statement to use 'class Lecture' instead of 'class Course' to ensure consistent naming across all artifacts and prevent confusion in conceptual mapping.
